main event: A round object, solid green with a flashing red and green color, was observed on ground radar in Minneapolis, Minnesota on January 2, 1957.
interesting points: The object moved up to an altitude of 50,000 feet to the east and then up to 30,000 feet to the west.
The observation was made by a ground-controlled approach (GCA) radar system.
The report states that there was insufficient data to evaluate the sighting.
The object was described as being smaller than a silver dollar and flashing red every few seconds.
The object appeared to be hovering and did not ascend, leading the observer to believe it was not an aircraft.
sighted object: a round, solid green object with flashing red and green lights
